Types

Amlet.LogitUtility — Type
LogitUtility{L <: isLinear}

Fields

  • u::Function : utility function for Logit model
  • grad::Function : gradient
    • x::Any
    • beta::AbstractVector
    • i::Int
  • H::Function : Hessian matrix
    • x::Any
    • beta::AbstractVector

source

Functions

Objective

This is the computation of the objective function

\[-\dfrac{1}{N} \sum_{i=1}^{N} \sum_{j=1}^{n_{alt}} y_{ij}\log\big( \mathbb{P}(j \vert \beta , X) \big) \]

Sofia.F — Function
F(x, mo; sample , update)

Function to compute the averaged negative log-likelihood of the Logit model over a sampled population.

Arguments

  • x::Vector{T}` is the parameter vector
  • mo::LogitModel{UPD, D} is the Logit modelwhere data is stored
  • sample = 1:length(mo.data) is the sampled population used for computation, by default full.
  • update::Bool = false is for use of storage Engine.
source
Sofia.Fs — Function
Fs(x, mo; sample)

Computation of the negative log-likelihoods for all individuals in the selected population.

Returns an array comtaining all values.

Arguments

  • x::Vector{T}` is the parameter vector
  • mo::LogitModel{UPD, D} is the Logit modelwhere data is stored
  • sample = 1:length(mo.data) is the sampled population used for computation, by default full.
source
Sofia.Fs! — Function
Fs!(x, mo, ac; sample , inplace)

Computation of the negative log-likelihoods for all individuals in the selected population.

Modifies the ac array in place.

Arguments

  • x::Vector{T}` is the parameter vector
  • mo::LogitModel{UPD, D} is the Logit modelwhere data is stored
  • ac::Array is the accumulator vector to modify in place
  • sample = 1:length(mo.data) is the sampled population used for computation, by default full
  • inplace::Bool = false
source
